tachyon.security.login

Class AppLoginModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.security.login.AppLoginModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginModule

    public final class AppLoginModule
extends Object
implements LoginModule
    An app login module that creates a user based on the user name provided through application configuration. Specifically, through Java system property tachyon.security.login.username. This module is useful if multiple Tachyon clients running under same OS user name want to get different identifies (for resource and data management), or if Tachyon clients running under different OS user names want to get same identify.

      • login

        public boolean login()
              throws LoginException
        Retrieves the user name by querying the property of Constants.SECURITY_LOGIN_USERNAME.
        Specified by:
        login in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true if user name provided by application is set and not empty
        Throws:
        LoginException

      • abort

        public boolean abort()
              throws LoginException
        Aborts the authentication (second phase).

        This method is called if the LoginContext's overall authentication failed. (login failed) It cleans up any state that was changed in the login and commit methods.

        Specified by:
        abort in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true in all cases
        Throws:
        LoginException

      • commit

        public boolean commit()
               throws LoginException
        Commits the authentication (second phase).

        This method is called if the LoginContext's overall authentication succeeded. The implementation first checks if there is already Tachyon user in the subject. If not, it adds the previously logged in Tachyon user into the subject.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true if a Tachyon user if found or created
        Throws:
        LoginException - not Tachyon user is found or created

      • logout

        public boolean logout()
               throws LoginException
        Logs out the user

        The implementation removes the User associated with the Subject.

        Specified by:
        logout in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true in all cases
        Throws:
        LoginException - if logout fails
